If you’re looking for an opportunity to build out the nascent IT Department of an Inc. 5000 rapidly-growing organization, taking senior responsibility, not just for systems administration, but also for driving new initiatives designed to scale our IT infrastructure as this company grows from 34 employees to 100+ over the next few years, our IT Administrator (aka System Administrator) role may be for you.


You will be the only full-time IT hire in this company, responsible for up-leveling (a) the technical support we can give our growing team of remote employees, and (b) the sophistication and scalability of our IT infrastructure. It’s an opportunity to play a pivotal role in building out the IT infrastructure of a rapidly growing company as it scales.

This is not an entry-level role. We’re looking for someone with significant experience in Microsoft 365 administration to come alongside us to up-level our IT architecture in a way that will help this company scale efficiently and securely. An ideal applicant would, therefore, have a degree in computer science, systems engineering, or network administration, as well as a Microsoft 365 Certification “Administrator Expert” certification being preferred.


With that said, we understand that many of the most talented IT professionals took career paths that didn’t go through traditional educational institutions, nor have they prioritized chasing Microsoft certification to validate skills they have acquired through experience. So, if it’s possible for you to quickly get the aforementioned Microsoft Certifications, that would enhance your application. But we will give all applicants an opportunity to demonstrate their skills and experience throughout this process, even if they don’t check all the rigid academic and certification boxes that would be ideal.

 

Working within a Distributed Workforce

This is a fully remote role. Approximately four times per year, we will pay you to fly out to our headquarters in Scottsdale, AZ to get an opportunity to connect with your colleagues in person and align on quarterly objectives. Beyond that, however, your primary interaction with your colleagues will be through the cloud-based tech stack we leverage to align our distributed workforce, which includes employees across the United States.

 

Notwithstanding the virtual nature of our model, at present, we are only hiring applicants who reside within the continental United States (excluding CA) to minimize HR and tax complexities and to keep our team within four time zones of each other.

 

Key Responsibilities

Provide administrative and technical support for all IT assets within our diverse tech stack.

  • Serve as the primary administrator of all assets within our diverse tech stack.
  • Creating user accounts, performing access control, and assist colleagues with issues as they arise.
  • Performing diagnostic tests and debugging procedures to optimize computer systems.
  • Identify, diagnose, and resolve any technical issues that arise, ensuring minimal downtime and disruption to operations.
  • Configure and enforce SSO policies accross our tech stack, as well as all related password policies and security best practices.

Manage and up-level our cloud infrastructure.

  • Configure and manage all aspects of Microsoft 365 users, from email and group setup, to teams and SharePoint administraton.
  • Manage the installation of servers, network devices, and firewalls to ensure a secure and efficient network environment.
  • Continuously monitor the performance of all servers, software, and hardware to ensure they are operating efficiently and effectively.
  • Coordinate the deployment of new applications, ensuring they are integrated smoothly and efficiently into the existing infrastructure.

Drive the creation of enterprise-grade IT systems architecture and management.

  • Drive the buildout and implementation of new IT initiatives.
  • Maintain and update technical documentation related to system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps.
  • Work with leadership to put in place enterprise-grade security architecture and policies to comply with SEC expectations.

 

Qualifications

Required Soft Skills:

  • Enthusiasm, high integrity, and a commitment to live out the organization’s 5 core values of transparency, collaboration, curiosity, visionariness, and hustle.
  • Desire to grow intellectually and professionally as part of an Inc. 5000 rapidly-growing organization.
  • Intellectually curious, with ability to help others navigate a tech stack designed to organize a distributed workforce.
  • Ability to be patient and relay complex information in accessible ways.

Required Hard/Technical Skills & Abilities:

  • Microsoft 365 Administration
  • SharePoint Online Administration
  • Entra ID Administration, MDM

Education, Certification & Experience Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, systems engineering, network administration, or cyber security.
  • Microsoft 365 Certification as an "Administrator Expert" certification being preferred. Other desirable certifications include “Security Operations Analyst” , “IAM Associate”, “ITIL”, “CISSP”, or “CompTIA”
  • 3+ years of IT Administration experience within a professional services or tech firm at a minimum, 5+ years' experience preferred.

… or equivalent experience, and the ability to demonstrate the requisite level of technical skills the degrees and certifications above are designed to validate.

Preferred Skills (for bonus points!)

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Purview and Defender
  • Azure Management

 

Compensation

Compensation for this role is $70,000 per year. Additionally, the firm offers a generous benefits package that includes, among other benefits, flexible PTO, fully subsidized healthcare, a 401(k)-matching program, and an Employee Stock Ownership Plan at no cost to you.

 

Dew Wealth Management is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Please submit all inquiries to recruiting@dewwealth.com -- there is no guarantee that you will be followed up with properly except by applying through the external site provided.

title: IT Administrator

job_description:
Simplesense builds, deploys, and sustains the Installation Resilience Platform that enables mission operators to rapidly adapt and respond. The Platform protects critical infrastructure from cyber attack while unlocking previously siloed information to monitor, diagnose, and improve response times to incidents. Our adversaries rapidly adopt the latest technology: we help defense users respond in kind.

Simplesense is a non-traditional defense contractor and prime on the Air Force's Installation Resilience Operations Command and Control (IROC) program, which is now expanding to five additional Air Force, Space Force, and Army installations from the one prototype installation, Tyndall Air Force Base.

Our team combines over 100 years of direct mission experience solving hard problems with 50 years technical expertise deploying DevSecOps, cybersecurity, and cloud infrastructure, giving us a deep appreciation for our customers’ mission and end users’ priorities. We build for scale, architecting and prioritizing technical work for long term sustainability.

Simplesense is looking for a motivated and detail-oriented System Administrator to join our remote, US-based team. The System Administrator oversees continuous proactive maintenance of hardware and software assets to prevent downtime and zero-day exploits from occurring.

This position will join the Operations and Sustainment Team and be responsible for maintaining physical and virtualized Windows OS Servers and Workstations, hardening activities to maintain a strong cybersecurity posture, and providing first-level technical support to users.

The ideal candidate is an excellent communicator, attentive, and efficient. They can complete work skillfully and independently. The System Administrator must be good at giving and receiving constructive feedback.

Responsibilities:

  • Install and configure software and hardware
  • Administer Active Directory (AD) accounts
  • Perform preventive maintenance for systems including patching, system back-ups, error log reviews, database size, and integrity checks
  • Monitor performance and maintain systems according to requirements
  • Ensure security through access controls, backups and firewalls
  • Triage customer support tickets, provide Tier 1 help desk support and Tier 2 escalation
  • Communicate with customers and technical specialists
  • Contribute to our internal wiki with technical documentation

Requirements:

  • Proven experience as a System Administrator, Network Administrator or similar role
  • Experience with virtualized Windows OS Servers and Workstations
  • Experience with Group Policy Object (GPO)
  • Experience with patch management and patch management solutions
  • Knowledge of system security (e.g. intrusion detection systems) and data backup/recovery
  • Ability to create scripts in Powershell, Python or other languages
  • Resourcefulness and problem-solving aptitude
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, or similar
  • Must be a US Citizen and able to obtain a DoD NIPR account and Common Access Card (CAC)
  • Ability to effectively use Simplesense IT Systems (Google Workspace, Slack, Jira, Confluence, Lucid for virtual whiteboards)
  • Operational Technology(OT) or Industrial Control Systems (ICS) experience a plus

Competitive benefits package including equity

  • Medical, Life, Short-Term Disability, and AD&D insurance
  • Medical travel coverage
  • Dental coverage
  • Vision coverage
  • 401K matching
  • Equity

Salary Range: $88,000 - $105,000

  • Communicate status to customers throughout the lifecycle of a support ticket
  • Identify methods to reduce overall O&M burden through automation and effective triage
  • Contribute to troubleshooting playbooks
  • Track ticket progress using Jira Service Manager

title: Vice President of Technology

job_description:
CTO – $295,000 – Remote (US Based)


I’m working with a leading construction software company that’s at the forefront of transforming the way construction projects are managed. Their innovative solutions help construction teams streamline workflows, enhance collaboration, and leverage real-time data for better decision-making. With significant growth underway, they are looking for a dynamic and visionary Chief Technology Officer (CTO) to join their leadership team and help drive their technological strategy.


About the Role:

As the CTO, you’ll be responsible for leading the technical direction and strategy of the company’s product suite, overseeing engineering and product teams, and ensuring that the company’s technology meets the evolving needs of the construction industry. You will play a key role in shaping the future of the company’s platform and expanding their offerings, all while leading a talented team of engineers and collaborating closely with the leadership team.


Key Responsibilities:

1. Technology Strategy & Leadership

  • Develop & Execute Strategy: Lead the creation and execution of the company’s technology roadmap, aligning it with business goals and customer needs in the construction space.
  • Innovative Product Leadership: Guide the development of new features and products that leverage emerging technologies like IoT, AI, real-time data, and BIM to address critical pain points in construction project management.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with product, sales, and operations teams to prioritize development efforts and ensure technology supports the company’s overall business objectives.

2. Engineering & Development Workstreams

  • Platform Development & Scaling: Oversee the design, development, and scaling of the product platform, ensuring it’s built to be secure, scalable, and able to handle complex data processing in real-time.
  • Infrastructure & Security: Ensure the platform’s infrastructure is robust, secure, and compliant with industry regulations, while driving improvements in performance and reliability.
  • Continuous Delivery & Agile Practices: Promote best practices in Agile development, DevOps, and CI/CD to deliver new features and fixes rapidly, while maintaining high product quality.

3. Team Leadership & Growth

  • Build & Scale Engineering Teams: Lead and expand the engineering team, hiring key technical talent and providing mentorship to support the growth of the department.
  • Foster Innovation & Collaboration: Cultivate a culture of continuous learning and improvement, empowering engineers to innovate while ensuring alignment with the company's goals.

4. Customer-Focused Product Development

  • Customer Feedback & Data-Driven Decisions: Work closely with the customer success team to understand client pain points, incorporating this feedback into product development cycles to enhance user experience and product adoption.
  • Collaborate on Industry Solutions: Leverage your deep understanding of the construction industry to ensure that the products meet the unique needs of construction professionals and align with industry standards.

5. Strategic Partnerships

  • Build Key Partnerships: Foster relationships with key vendors, cloud providers, and third-party technology companies to integrate the latest technologies into the platform and enhance its capabilities.


Ideal Candidate Profile:

  • Experience in technical leadership roles, with at least 5 years in a CTO or VP of Engineering position. Experience in the construction or AEC (Architecture, Engineering, Construction) sectors is highly preferred.
  • Industry Knowledge: Deep understanding of the challenges and opportunities in the construction industry, particularly with respect to software solutions for project management, scheduling, budgeting, and real-time collaboration.
  • Technical Expertise: Hands-on experience with cloud computing, mobile applications, real-time data processing, APIs, and integrations with third-party systems (ERP, BIM, etc.).
  • Leadership: Proven success in leading and scaling engineering teams, mentoring talent, and fostering a culture of collaboration and innovation.
  • Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex technical ideas to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, and to advocate for technology initiatives with the executive team.


Why Consider This Opportunity?

  • Growth Potential: Play a key role in scaling a rapidly growing company and have a direct impact on the transformation of the construction industry.
  • Work Flexibility: Choose between remote or hybrid working options, offering a great work-life balance and flexibility.
  • Cutting-Edge Tech: Work with the latest technologies to solve real-world problems for an industry that’s ripe for innovation.

About Us:

LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 700+ clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world. Powered by nearly 90,000 talented and entrepreneurial professionals across more than 30 countries, LTIMindtree — a Larsen & Toubro Group company — combines the industry-acclaimed strengths of erstwhile Larsen and Toubro Infotech and Mindtree in solving the most complex business challenges and delivering transformation at scale. For more information, please visit www.ltimindtree.com

Job Title: ITSM Consultant

Location: New York, NY (Remote)


Job Description:

  • Good to have Knowledge on ServiceNow Application Ticket Creation
  • ServiceNow Operations
  • Monitor the ServiceNow queue for Blurelated tickets
  • Categorize prioritize and assign ticket types login issues product questions bug reports
  • Maintain SLA compliance and escalate where needed
  • Blu Login Support
  • Diagnose and resolve user login failures or errors SSO issues expired sessions MFA problems
  • Perform entitlement checks and liaise with IT support if systemlevel access updates are required
  • Escalation Management
  • Route verified bug reports with reproduction steps to Product Marketing and Engineering teams
  • Use Akkios designated intake process for submitting and tracking feature requests
  • Track escalations and follow up on resolution statuses
  • Customer Communication
  • Communicate resolution steps to users
  • Provide updates during triage or escalated issue resolution
  • Ensure professionalism and consistency in tone and content
  • Documentation Feedback Loop
  • Update ServiceNow knowledge base articles based on recurring issues
  • Document known errors and temporary workarounds
  • Participate in retrospectives with Product Marketing for continuous improvement


Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with LTIMindtree (“LTIM”):


Benefits and Perks:

• Comprehensive Medical Plan Covering Medical, Dental, Vision

• Short Term and Long-Term Disability Coverage

• 401(k) Plan with Company match

• Life Insurance

• Vacation Time, Sick Leave, Paid Holidays

• Paid Paternity and Maternity Leave


The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum salary target for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and job level and additional factors including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Depending on the position offered, other forms of compensation may be provided as part of overall compensation like an annual performance-based bonus, sales incentive pay and other forms of bonus or variable compensation.

job_description:
About Us

Hungryroot is using AI to build the most consumer-centric food and wellness company to ever exist. We are your personal assistant for healthy living. We get to know your goals, lifestyle, and budget, and we recommend and deliver healthy groceries, easy recipes and essential supplements for you and your family. It’s the easiest way to eat healthy, achieve your goals, save time, and discover new foods. Founded on the belief that food is the foundation of health, convenience should not mean compromise, and we’re all unique in how we eat and live, Hungryroot is building a future in which healthy living is easy and enjoyable.

We are a distributed team built on top talent from over 28 states across the U.S. While we have a headquarters in New York City, we support employees working from wherever they are based. We believe in fostering team connection and collaboration across all of our employees' locations. Expect to attend regular team building events and an annual company retreat. Expect to be treated like an owner who cares about our common goal, not someone who has to clock in and out of work.

About The Role

We are looking for a IT Systems Administrator to be a part of our growing IT team ideally located in the NYC/surrounding area. This role will join Hungryroot’s IT team and you will report directly to our Sr. IT Administrator. You will be responsible for the monitoring, maintenance, security, and optimization of Hungryroot computer systems as well as being the point of contact for IT tickets and issues. They will be responsible for ordering, setup, and deployment of Hungryroot devices to employees and assist with A/V setup for various company meetings and events.If you want to help us change how people grocery shop and eat for the better, we encourage you to apply!

Responsibilities

  • Answer tickets, quickly resolve any system failures and troubleshoots issues
  • Manage new hire onboarding, equipment purchases, and manage inventory
  • Manage and deploy our MDM software and patching policies
  • Manage user accounts, credentials, permissions, access rights, storage allocations, and general administration
  • Secure system integrity from any breaches or viruses and play an essential role in risk-mitigation planning, including creating backup plans, safeguards for data, user security policies, and identity management
  • Research upcoming products, service protocols, and standards in support of systems software procurement and development efforts and make recommendations
  • Assist with A/V setup and breakdowns
  • Able to lift up to 35 lbs
  • Have a presence in the NYC office for at least 2-3 days out of the week
  • Some short-term travel will be required within the United States on a project-by-project basis

Qualifications

  • Minimum of 2 years working as a systems administrator with previous experience on a helpdesk
  • Experience with administration for a wide arrange of applications and platforms, deployments, and integrations
  • 1+ year experience working with OKTA
  • Experience with Mac/Windows
  • Experience utilizing Google Suite and Microsoft Office
  • MDM and provisioning experience (JumpCloud, Apple DEP, or other)
  • Working with an IT Ticketing system
  • Being detail oriented, having excellent communication and customer care skills and proficiency with documentation or reporting

Perks & Benefits

  • Remote-first: work from home, work from our NYC office, work from anywhere in the U.S. - you decide!
  • Equity
  • Unlimited vacation policy
  • Universal paid parental leave
  • Monthly Hungryroot credit for delicious, healthy groceries
  • Comprehensive health, vision, dental, and life insurance
  • Wellbeing benefits including One Medical, Spring Health, LiveHealth, Rightway care concierge, and more
  • 401k
  • A work from home stipend to support your initial home-office setup

The employer will not sponsor applicants for work visas.

Our mission to help make healthy eating easy, accessible, and joyful is better served by a diverse workplace. We are a proud Equal Opportunity Employer committed to building an inclusive workplace. We have zero-tolerance for harassment or discrimination. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected class.
title: IT Systems Administrator

job_description:
Lensa is the leading career site for job seekers at every stage of their career. Our client, Shuvel Digital, is seeking professionals. Apply via Lensa today!

Greetings!

Our client is the world's largest credit union with over 10 million members, over $149 billion in assets, and over 23,000 employees.

Our client Navy Federal Credit Union is seeking an IT Programmer-15288-Remote. You seem to have a rock-solid profile and your overall background seems to be a great match for the position.

Please review the below information for clarity on the position description.

Description

We are looking for an experienced programmer, who can review programs written in COBOL/CICS/ DB2/JCL, design, document, develop and deploy code to production in a timely fashion.

Ability to analyze business needs and convert them into technical requirements, develop and deploy code, and collaborate with testing and business teams to test the new functionality.

They should be able to work with and communicate and collaborate with peers, management, business partners, staff, and other vendors.

Ability to exercise initiative, produce desired results and achieve objectives.

Effective planning and organizational skills

Able to multitask and support project work.

Desired Skills

  • Knowledge of Tax system
  • FIS ALLTEL/SYSTEMATICS application knowledge (TX, IM, ST, AM, RM, SC, HX and GN)
  • ITSM (Incident, Release, Change)
  • Serena ChangeMan Deployment tool
  • IBM OnDemand Admin or working knowledge.
  • GoAnywhere working knowledge desired.

I would appreciate the opportunity to connect and discuss this further. Please feel free to call or email me at your convenience, or let me know a suitable time for us to connect.
title: IT - (Remote)

job_description:
About Vivid Impact

Vivid Impact has been a pioneer in the graphic communications industry for over 50 years, growing from a small commercial printing service into a global leader in marketing technology. Since our founding in 1974, we have combined creativity with precision to deliver innovative print and digital solutions that drive success. With a team of over 350 dedicated professionals, we are committed to making a positive, lasting impact on our team, partners, and the communities we serve. Guided by our mission, we strive to be the trusted marketing technology resource for organizations looking to achieve better results, providing cutting-edge solutions that enhance brand engagement and performance.

Job Overview

The VP of Technology will drive the development and implementation of technology best practices across the organization. This role is responsible for leading and managing the technology team, ensuring that all technical objectives are met. Key areas of focus include risk management, resource allocation, project prioritization, and the evaluation and recommendation of new systems, tools, and software solutions. The VP will play a critical role in shaping the organization's technology direction and ensuring its alignment with overall business goals.

Shift Details

1st Shift: Monday - Friday, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM.

What You'll Do

  • Set the overall technical vision and strategy for products.
  • Align technology decisions with business goals and market needs.
  • Make critical architectural decisions that impact product scalability and competitiveness.
  • Evaluate and adopt new technologies to gain competitive advantages.
  • Lead and mentor development and IT teams.
  • Work closely with the QA team to ensure high-quality standards.
  • Collaborate with the Product Manager on roadmap planning and execution.
  • Foster a positive engineering culture focused on innovation and quality.
  • Oversee system architecture and key design decisions.
  • Ensure technical scalability as the customer base grows.
  • Manage technical debt and drive refactoring initiatives.
  • Establish coding standards, best practices, and development processes.
  • Implement security, compliance, and data protection measures.
  • Participate in strategic business decisions with the CEO, President, and Executive Team.
  • Translate complex technical concepts for non-technical stakeholders.
  • Support sales and marketing with technical insight and expertise.
  • Manage technology partnerships and vendor relationships.
  • Guide product development to ensure technical feasibility of new features.
  • Oversee Continuous Improvement/Continuous Delivery pipeline and software deployment
  • processes.
  • Make critical decisions about the technology stack and infrastructure.

What We're Looking For

  • 10+ years of experience in technology leadership.
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • Proven track record leading development teams and launching software products.
  • Extensive experience leading development teams and managing software product launches.
  • Experience in marketing technology organizations (MarTech).
  • Familiarity with modern development tools and frameworks; hands-on development experience is a plus.
  • Experience leading hybrid and remote teams across multiple locations.
  • Comfortable making strategic technology decisions in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong communicator and cross-functional collaborator.
  • Innovative, detail-oriented, and accountable leadership style.
  • Familiarity with the Laravel TALL stack (Tailwind CSS, Alpine.js, Laravel, Livewire) is a plus.
  • Understanding of cybersecurity best practices and compliance standards strongly preferred.

Vivid Impact provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Salary: $225000 - $250000 per year

job_description:
Join a dynamic startup insurance business as an interim IT Operations Manager.


We are seeking a leader with a strong background in operations management, supplier management, end-user support, and infrastructure. Reporting to the Global Head of IT Operations, you will build the US IT Operations function to oversee technology vendor management across the US business.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage IT operations across infrastructure, networks, cloud services, and end-user support.
  • Oversee MSP relationships and identify in-sourcing opportunities.
  • Ensure service quality through incident, problem, and change management (ITIL).
  • Govern service delivery to meet KPIs and SLAs.
  • Maintain system performance and resilience.
  • Act as escalation point for major incidents.
  • Collaborate with security, architecture, and delivery teams.
  • Oversee vendor contracts and asset management.
  • Support compliance, audit readiness, and IT governance.


Key Requirements:


  • Significant IT operations experience - having previous built IT operations will be advantageous.
  • Insurance or regulated financial services experience - startup/scale-up experience is beneficial.
  • Strong knowledge of infrastructure, networking, cloud platforms (Azure), and IT service management.
  • Proven MSP management and transition leadership.
  • Familiarity with ITIL, DevOps, CASM.
  • Agile environment experience.
  • Process maturity frameworks and audits experience.
  • Results-driven and proactive.
  • Out-of-hours support experience.
  • Exposure to “follow the sun” support models.
  • Effective leadership and stakeholder management.
  • Strong commercial awareness and problem-solving skills.


This is a start up business with no US office at present. They will be looking to open an office on the Eastern seaboard in H2 of 2025.
title: IT Operations Manager - US (Insurance)

job_description:
Job Summary:

As the Chief Technology Officer, you will be responsible for defining and executing the company's technology vision and strategy. You will oversee all aspects of technology development, infrastructure, cybersecurity, and innovation, ensuring that our technology solutions align with business goals and industry trends. The ideal candidate is a strategic leader with strong technical expertise and a track record of driving technology initiatives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and execute a comprehensive technology strategy that supports business objectives
  • Lead and manage the technology team, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement
  • Oversee the development and implementation of scalable, secure, and high-performance technology solutions
  • Ensure the integrity, security, and compliance of all digital systems and data
  • Evaluate and integrate emerging technologies to enhance operational efficiency and competitive advantage
  • Collaborate with executive leadership to align technology initiatives with company goals
  • Manage technology budgets, resources, and vendor relationships effectively
  • Establish and maintain best practices in software development, cloud computing, and IT governance
  • Drive the adoption of AI, automation, and data-driven decision-making in recruitment technology
  • Represent the company in technology-related partnerships, conferences, and industry events.


Requirements

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field
  • 10+ years of experience in technology leadership roles, including CTO, VP of Engineering, or similar positions
  • Strong background in software development, cloud computing, and IT infrastructure
  • Expertise in cybersecurity, data privacy, and compliance standards
  • Proven experience managing technology teams and driving digital transformation initiatives
  • Knowledge of AI, machine learning, and automation in business applications
  • Excellent problem-solving, leadership, and strategic thinking skills
  • Strong communication and ability to work effectively in a remote environment


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in the executive search, recruitment, or HR tech industry
  • Familiarity with SaaS platforms, enterprise software, and API development
  • Previous experience scaling technology solutions in a high-growth company


Benefits

  • Competitive salary range of $180,000 - $250,000 per year, based on experience and qualifications
  • Performance-based bonuses and equity options
  • Fully remote work environment with flexible scheduling
  • Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance

title: Chief Technology Officer (Remote)

job_description:
At Foley, we are revolutionizing the way companies recruit, screen, and monitor drivers. This is an exciting time for us as we scale our B2B vertical SaaS business and modernize our products for the future. If you are a strategic thinker who thrives in complexity, is energized by impact, and wants to work with a team passionate about building great products and helping customers, we would love to talk to you.

We believe in Teammateship, Grit and Innovation .... our core values. Whether collaborating internally or assisting customers, we approach every challenge with humor, optimism, and a commitment to success.

A customer support agent at Foley, plays a vital role in ensuring customer satisfaction and success. Handling a variety of tasks, including responding to customer inquiries through calls, emails, and chats, and providing timely and accurate assistance. They troubleshoot technical issues, guiding customers through troubleshooting steps and offering detailed information about the product's features and functionalities. Building and maintaining positive relationships with customers is crucial, as is gathering and relaying customer feedback to the product and management teams. Customer support agents also manage complex or escalated issues, collaborating with other departments when necessary, and keep detailed records of customer interactions for future reference.

This is a remote option-those residing in CT, MA, GA, SC, FL & TX are welcome to apply!

Pay: $18.25-Full-Time, Monday-Friday 8am-8pm EST (evening availability required two evening per week)

Requirements

  • Support clients, drivers, and candidates in understanding DOT and FCRA regulations
  • Conduct employment verifications and gather crucial information
  • Respond to client questions, review driver documents, and process compliance documents
  • Maintain expertise in regulations and Foley products and educate clients on drug testing and background checks
  • Promote Foley's reputation and deliver outstanding customer service
  • Build and maintain positive relationships with customers, ensuring to provided support.
  • Keep detailed records of customers interactions and issues for future reference.
  • Guide customers through troubleshooting steps.
  • Handle complex or escalates issues, collaborating with other departments as needed.
  • Handle incomings and outbound calls, emails, and chats messages from customers.


Requirements

  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Exceptional communication skills - verbal and written
  • Remote experience preferred
  • Experience working with SaaS Applications
  • Reliable internet connectivity and a peaceful working environment
  • Flexibility for shift-based work, including evenings
  • Capability to adjust to shifting priorities
  • Experience in and the aptitude to provide exceptional customer service
  • Motivated individual with a proactive approach, mainly in remote setting
  • Strong work ethic and exceptional integrity
  • Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality and uphold professionalism
  • Strong computer skills in Microsoft Office, Outlook, and the ability to utilize internal systems
  • Demonstrated aptitude for effective organizational and prioritization abilities
  • A strong desire to develop long-term professional growth


Benefits

WHAT YOU'LL LOVE ABOUT FOLEY

The People: Our close-knit, exceptionally talented teams are the heart of Foley. Our employees and customers consistently highlight our team spirit. Check out our customer feedback on Trustpilot.

Outstanding Benefits: Choose from 3 medical plans, 2 levels of dental, and 2 levels of vision plans. Enjoy generous vacation, sick, and personal time off, plus a 401K plan with a match. We support your well-being so you can live your best life.

Ideas Over Egos: In our entrepreneurial environment, you have the freedom to explore new ideas and approaches, backed by a collaborative team.

Professional Growth: We prioritize internal growth and encourage employees to apply for new opportunities. Our People Operations team is here to help you plan and achieve your career goals.

Our Environment: We celebrate success and believe in transparency and teamwork. We invest in collaboration tools to ensure face-to-face interactions, even in a virtual space. Many of our roles are remote, but we ensure our employees remain engaged and connected.

What We Do, How We Do It

Many companies handle recruitment, background screening, and regulatory management in a fragmented way, using different vendors for recruitment, screening, and regulatory requirements. This approach is inefficient, costly, and increases the risk of overlooking important details.

At Foley, we offer a seamless platform that manages recruitment, screening, and regulatory requirements under one roof. By integrating powerful technology with our deep expertise, we provide comprehensive and superior experience for our customers.

Where We're Headed

We are continuously developing new solutions to address future challenges in recruitment, screening, and regulatory management. Our focus is on leveraging extensive data collection and innovative technologies, such as predictive analytics, to identify top talent and assess company risks. Our goal is to deliver cutting-edge solutions that drive success.

What It's Like to Work with Us

  • Diving Deep: Become an expert in a niche industry.
  • Continual Growth: Advance your career and skills.
  • Lifelong Friends: Build lasting relationships along the way.

We are a 250+ person company on the brink of explosive growth, thanks to our AI-powered technology and predictive analytics. If you're ready to join our journey, visit us at:

www.foleyservices.com

Who You'll Work With

As a Business Analyst, you'll work closely with Engineering, Operations, and Sales.

Because our departments work so closely together, we're always looking to improve our current process. We welcome new ways to work collaboratively with roles and departments. We can't wait to hear your ideas!

What You Will Do

  • Analyze datasets to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement
  • Work closely with stakeholders to gather, define, and document business requirements
  • Triage and review issues with functionality and determine alignment with business expectations
  • Collaborate with Product, Engineering, Sales, and Customer Success teams to align with business requirements and needs
  • Evaluate SaaS metrics such as product usage analytics
  • Recommend solutions and optimizations to processes based on data findings
  • Drive continuous improvement through process analysis and automation opportunities


What We'd Like You To Have

  • 2-4 years of experience as a Business Analyst or in a similar role in a SaaS technology environment
  • Experience with CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce, Dynamics 365); product analytics tools (e.g., Heap, Google Analytics)
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with experience in SQL, Excel, and BI tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI)
  • Familiarity with SaaS business models and metrics
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to translate data into actionable insights
  • Bachelor's degree in business, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or related field
  • Knowledge of computing platforms, software architecture, and database designs
  • Understanding of product development lifecycle and experience with SDLC tools such as Atlassian's suite of tools or Azure DevOps
  • Proficiency with Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint


AN IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL DEMONSTRATE

  • Empathy - Understanding user's needs and bringing value to them is at the heart of a product manager's job
  • Growth mindset — Be curious about everything related to the product-market, customers, users, value, and performance. Retrospect, seek feedback, and continuously improve
  • Results-Driven — Seek out others who can help, ask the difficult questions, identify what needs to be done, and plan accordingly to ensure timely delivery
  • Analytical Thinking — Use a logical, systematic, sequential approach to problem-solving
  • Work with experts — Build good relationships with experts in your field, operations, business analysts, engineering, and testing
  • Good communication skills — Talk to people who are involved in the product, customers, and leaders about the product. You should be able to understand their language and how they talk about it


What Matters To Us

Our people are one of our most important assets. Our culture is what unites us and guides us in our daily work. We look for people who Get It, Want It, and Can Do It! We do all we can to make Foley a place where each person can be a true master of their craft and is positioned for success.

What We Do, How We Do It

Many companies handle recruitment, background screening, and regulatory management in a fragmented way, using different vendors for recruitment, screening, and regulatory requirements. This approach is inefficient, costly, and increases the risk of overlooking important details.

At Foley, we offer a seamless platform that manages recruitment, screening, and regulatory requirements under one roof. By integrating powerful technology with our deep expertise, we provide a comprehensive and superior experience for our customers.

Where We're Headed

We are continuously developing new solutions to address future challenges in recruitment, screening, and regulatory management. job_description:
Position Title: Director of Delivery - IT Consulting

Location: USA, 100% Remote

Start Date: ASAP

Duration: Long Term

We are seeking a Growth-Oriented Onshore Director of Delivery to lead and scale our IT consulting projects in App Development, Data Integration, and Generative AI. This role requires a strategic and

hands-on leader who can drive successful project delivery, build strong client relationships, and

identify growth opportunities within the Utilities and Manufacturing sectors.

Primary Duties And Accountabilities

Project Delivery & Execution

  • Oversee end-to-end project execution across App Development, Data Integration, and AI initiatives, ensuring on-time and high-quality delivery.
  • Act as the primary point of contact for, preferably,enterprise clients in Utilities and Manufacturing, ensuring alignment with their business objectives.
  • Collaborate with onshore and offshore teams to optimize resource utilization and maintain efficiency.
  • Implement Agile and DevSecOps best practices for high-quality delivery in cloud environments (Azure, Oracle, Salesforce, or GCP).

Client Engagement & Growth

  • Establish and nurture trusted advisor relationships with key stakeholders preferably at Utilities and Manufacturing companies.
  • Identify upsell and cross-sell opportunities by aligning AI, Data Integration, and App Dev services with client needs.
  • Lead quarterly business reviews (QBRs) and project health checks to ensure customer satisfaction.

Business Expansion & Practice Development

  • Partner with sales and leadership teams to drive new business opportunities and expand our consulting footprint.
  • Develop and refine industry-specific offerings for Utilities and Manufacturing clients, showcasing value through AI-driven automation, cloud-native solutions, and integration accelerators.
  • Contribute to proposal development, RFP responses, and pre-sales engagements to win new projects.

Team Leadership & Operational Excellence

  • Drive operational improvements to enhance profitability, delivery efficiency, and customer satisfaction.
  • Ensure compliance with contractual SLAs and governance frameworks for IT service delivery.

Qualifications

  • 10+ years of experience in IT consulting, with a focus on App Development, Data Integration, or AI-driven solutions.
  • Proven track record of onshore delivery leadership, managing multi-million-dollar engagements.
  • Good to have strong domain expertise in Utilities and Manufacturing – understanding of industry trends, regulatory needs, and digital transformation challenges.
  • Experience managing hybrid delivery models (onshore/offshore teams) and collaborating with global teams.
  • Knowledge of Azure, Oracle, Salesforce, or other enterprise platforms is a plus.
  • Ability to identify growth opportunities, drive business expansion, and contribute to pre-sales efforts.
  • Strong customer-facing skills and the ability to build rapport and trust with customers.
title: Director of Delivery - IT Consulting (100% Remote)

job_description:
About Our Client

Our client believes that autonomous vehicle technology will transform how we travel, move freight, and do business.


A leader in autonomous driving since 2007, the company has spent over a decade commercializing their solutions with experienced partners. Now part of a larger organization, they are focused solely on developing software for automated trucks to transform how the world moves freight.


Join the IT Operations Team where you will be supporting and optimizing mission-critical Information Technology (IT) services.


What you will do:

Helpdesk - Communication, Response and Escalation

  • Responsible for triaging incoming requests through multiple input channels.
  • Troubleshooting and/or escalation to Systems Administration/Engineering team as needed.
  • Training end-users on systems use and operations from a wide range of technologies and solutions.
  • Working with end-users to determine and translate needs into actionable items.
  • Using and contributing to the internal knowledgebase, providing both internal as well as user- facing documentation as appropriate.
  • Using remote support tools to empower an extremely mobile workforce.
  • Participating in an on-call/after-hours rotation.
  • Assisting with inventory maintenance and records of all hardware and software.
  • Maintaining ticket hygiene and asset inventory updates in centralized systems.


IT Support

  • Deploying, reimaging, upgrading and troubleshooting end-user equipment.
  • Assisting with conference room solutions.
  • Providing support for general needs such as cable/adapter procurement.
  • End-user work area setup and upgrading.
  • Assist the Systems Administration/Engineering team with racking server and network gear.


What you will need to Succeed:

Education, Licensing, and Certifications Required

  • Associates degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, related field of study, or equivalent training and experience in an IT support environment.
  • Relevant certifications are a plus – ITIL v3/v4, CompTIA A+, Network+, Linux+, Security+ or similar.
  • Legally entitled to work in the US.


Experience, Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

  • 2+ years of experience in a helpdesk position assisting end-users with IT troubleshooting and problem-solving in a team setting.
  • Both Microsoft Windows, Mac OS, and Linux experience strongly preferred.
  • General understanding of Active Directory, Azure Active Directory, Office 365.
  • Proven experience in troubleshooting.
  • Foundational knowledge of networking principles, VoIP support, and virtualization technologies such as VMware and/or VDI environment support.
  • Exposure to compliance and security standards; basic knowledge of ISO/IEC 27001, NIST 800-53, or similar information security standards.


Perks of Being a Full-time Employee

The company cares about their team members and strives to provide benefits and resources to support their health, work/life balance, and future. The culture is collaborative, energetic, and team-focused. The company offers:

  • A competitive compensation package that includes a bonus component and stock options
  • 100% paid medical, dental, and vision premiums for full-time employees
  • 401K plan with an employer match

job_description:
About Our Client

A PE-backed start-up is a dynamic and innovative leader in the electronic prescribing software market, and its subsidiary is an industry leading insurance verification solution. The company is on a hyper-growth curve at the intersection of the software and healthcare industries. They need great team members to capitalize on these opportunities and improve the healthcare experience for patients and doctors alike. The company has an exciting opportunity to join a fun and growing team, benefit from strong market tailwinds, and be part of an exciting opportunity to ensure mission-critical prescriptions and verifications are delivered on time and without error.


About The Role:

As the IT Manager, you’ll lead the charge in building and scaling the infrastructure that powers the fully remote, high-growth organization. This role is both strategic and hands on – balancing long term IT planning with day-to-day support across systems, cybersecurity, and vendor management. You’ll work cross-functionally to drive operational excellence, safeguard data and systems, and ensure seamless technology experience for all global team members (currently have employees based in US and India).


What You'll Do:

  • Develop and implement comprehensive IT strategies aligned with business objectives
  • Manage technology budget, resource allocation, and strategic technology investments
  • Drive digital transformation and technology innovation initiatives
  • Ensure compliance with cybersecurity standards and regulatory requirements
  • Manage vendor relationships and technology partnerships
  • Setting & Monitoring Service Level Agreements (SLAs)
  • Daily maintenance, monitoring and troubleshooting for the fully remote organization (including onboarding and offboarding)
  • Own and maintain essential IT infrastructure, including operating systems, applications, email systems, laptops, desktops, software and hardware
  • Handle business-critical IT tasks and system administration
  • Research and evaluate emerging technologies


What You'll Bring:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field
  • At least five years of progressive IT leadership experience with a track record of scaling infrastructure in fast-paced, high growth environments.
  • Advanced technical knowledge of:
  • Enterprise network infrastructure
  • Cloud computing platforms
  • Cybersecurity frameworks
  • IT service management
  • Enterprise architecture
  • Proven success operating in a cloud-centric environment with experience implementing and testing scalable IT solutions
  • Strategic planning ability paired with strong execution, budget management, and vendor negotiation skills
  • Skilled in change management, problem-solving, applying creative and analytical thinking to real-world challenges
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills with experience supporting cross-functional teams and translating technical issues for non-technical stakeholders
  • Experience mentoring IT team members and building service-oriented teams
  • Certifications such as ITIL, CPAM, PMP, or cloud-based credentials are a plus but not required


You'll Enjoy This Role If:

This role is ideal for someone who enjoys hands-on execution and efficiently guiding teams through the day-to-day operations, thriving in a coach-player role.


Benefits & Perks:

🌍Remote work environment with a flexible work schedule to encourage work-life balance

✈Annual company offsite

🌴Generous leave package including flexible time off policy that encourages team members to take time off to relax and recharge; plus 13 paid holidays, paid sick leave, and paid parental leave

💙Medical, dental, and vision insurance for you and your family, plus a company funded FSA & HSA (dependent on which medical plan you choose)

💰401(k) company match

💸One-time workspace reimbursement to help you optimize your remote workspace


Compensation

$115K – $132K


The hiring company welcomes applicants from all U.S. time zones, though they have a preference for those based in Central or Mountain time zones.

job_description:
Senior Director, Information Technology, AST

We are seeking a visionary Senior Director, Information Technology to lead our innovative company to new heights. As our Senior Director, Information Technology, you will be a part of the senior leadership team responsible for creating strategy, goals, and objectives for the business. You will play a pivotal role in developing and implementing technology strategies to drive efficiency, and support organizational growth. You will be responsible for staying ahead of the curve in terms of industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovation. This is a remote role based in the western region of the United States.

As a key member of the IT senior leadership team, reporting to the VP, CIO of IT and dotted line to the Division Presidents, the Senior Director is an influential role that also makes investment and priority trade-off decisions, assists in negotiating and managing vendor contracts, and recruits, retains, and develops high performing teams. In addition, the Senior Director role will take on special projects and initiatives on behalf of the CIO.

  • Strategic planning: Develop and implement long-term technology strategies and roadmaps that support the overall segment business goals and objectives. This includes identifying areas for improvement in existing processes and systems, developing plans to implement modern technologies and techniques to enhance production, and defining metrics specific for the IT strategy to be achieved.
  • Technology evaluation and selection: Continuously monitor emerging technologies and assess their potential impact on the manufacturing industry. Evaluate and recommend innovative technologies and tools for the company to adopt and integrate into its operations.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure technology initiatives align with business needs and goals. Foster an environment of collaboration with senior business leaders and business units to drive innovation and progress.
  • Project management: Oversee the management and execution of technology projects, including managing timelines, budgets, and resources. Ensure projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the satisfaction of stakeholders. Ensure continuous alignment of project investments and initiatives with the business strategy.
  • Industry knowledge: Stay knowledgeable about the latest developments, trends, and best practices in the manufacturing industry and technology, and incorporate this knowledge into the company's strategy and operations. Encourage experimentation, reward creativity, and create forums for idea sharing.
  • Leadership: Develop, lead, and motivate the technology team, providing guidance and support to ensure their professional development and success. Focus on forecasting critical skills and using upskilling methods to close gaps.


Minimum Qualifications

● Bachelor’s degree in information technology

● A minimum of 5-7 years of experience in technology leadership positions with an emphasis on enterprise applications support in industrial manufacturing environments.

● Proven track record of innovation, both internal problem solving and in fostering innovative uses of technology as a qualification.

● Demonstrated experience in multiple, complex ERP system environments.

● Substantial experience leading, directing and controlling complex, highly technical IT operations and organizations.

● Direct ownership for technology selection and strategy

● Broad ERP (selection, design and implementation) and Enterprise Application responsibilities

● Experience in leading strategies for automation aligned with business goals.

● Experience supporting cloud environments (AWS, Azure) and CRM, BI/Data Analytics, Integration, Digital Commerce, Agile methodologies.

● Experience in technology management, specifically in the manufacturing industry

● Excellent leadership, communication, and people skills

● Proven history of delivering successful technology projects and solutions.

● Strong problem-solving and analytical skills

● Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.


Preferred Qualifications:

● A MS, MBA or related advanced degree is a plus.

● Automation experience in complex manufacturing environments.

● Experience with multiple ERP platforms is a plus.

Enpro is a leading industrial technology company focused on critical applications across many end-markets, including semiconductor, industrial process, commercial vehicle, sustainable power generation, aerospace, food and pharma, photonics and life sciences. The company operates in two segments: Sealing Products and Advanced Surface Technologies.

At Enpro, we believe that diversity drives innovation and inclusion fosters growth. We are committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued and respected. Our employment decisions are based on merit, qualifications, and business needs, without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, military service, or any other status protected by applicable law. If you require accommodation due to a disability at any time during the recruitment and/or assessment process, please contact Human Resources, and we will make all reasonable efforts to accommodate your request.

Enpro Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Legal authorization to work in the United States is required. We will not sponsor employment visas now or in the future for this job.

job_description:
At Webflow, our mission is to bring development superpowers to everyone. As the pioneer of the Website Experience Platform (WXP), we’re redefining how teams Build, Manage, and Optimize for the web — combining visual development, powerful content management systems, AI-driven personalization, seamless hosting, and end-to-end analytics in a single, unified platform. With AI at the core, Webflow helps teams move faster, create more performant digital experiences, and scale without heavy engineering support. From independent designers and creative agencies to global enterprises, hundreds of thousands of organizations use Webflow to turn ideas into reality — and to power what’s possible on the web.

We’re looking for a Director of IT Infrastructure and Operations to help us drive strategic IT initiatives, manage global infrastructure, oversee IT operations, and lead technology transformation projects. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in IT service management, Infrastructure and automation technologies, ensuring alignment with business objectives.

About The Role

  • Location: Remote-first (United States)
  • Full-time
  • Permanent
  • Exempt
  • The cash compensation for this role is tailored to align with the cost of labor in different geographic markets. We've structured the base pay ranges for this role into zones for our geographic markets, and the specific base pay within the range will be determined by the candidate’s geographic location, job-related experience, knowledge, qualifications, and skills.
    • United States (all figures cited below are in USD and pertain to workers in the United States)
      • Zone A: 177,300 - 252,000
      • Zone B: 166,500 - 236,700
      • Zone C: 155,700 - 221,850
This role is also eligible to participate in Webflow's company-wide bonus program. Target amounts are a percentage of base salary and vary by career level. Payouts are based on company performance against established financial and operational goals.

Please visit our Careers page for more information on which locations are included in each of our geographic pay zones. However, please confirm the zone for your specific location with your recruiter.

  • Reporting to the CIO

As a Director of IT Infrastructure and Operations, you’ll …

  • Develop and execute IT strategy to support business growth, optimize costs, and enhance operational efficiency.
  • Lead cloud and on-premise infrastructure operations, ensuring high availability and performance.
  • Spearhead initiatives like RPA, AI enabled workflows to enhance productivity and decision-making.
  • Implement best practices for IT governance, risk management, and compliance, achieving operational milestones.
  • Oversee large-scale IT projects, including application migrations, process automation, and integration of new technologies.
  • Build and manage high-performance global teams, fostering a culture of innovation and collaboration.
  • Negotiate and manage vendor contracts, ensuring optimal service delivery and cost efficiency.
  • Enhance IT infrastructure by adopting cloud-first strategies and automating routine processes.
  • Design and automate the entire employee IT lifecycle — from onboarding and access to transitions and offboarding.
  • Partner with leaders from other departments to solve cross-functional IT needs.

In addition to the responsibilities outlined above, at Webflow we will support you in identifying where your interests and development opportunities lie and we'll help you incorporate them into your role.

About You

Your qualifications and skills include...

  • Bachelor’s in IT or a related field; certifications in ITIL, Prince-2, or equivalent preferred.
  • Over 12 years of experience in IT service management, digital transformation, and infrastructure leadership.
  • Proven track record in scaling IT operations, preferably in a B2B SaaS or startup environment.
  • Strong understanding of cloud Infrastructure, Networking, Identity and Access management and IT governance.
  • Experienced in budgeting and cost optimization across tools, cloud, and vendors
  • Strong analytical and strategic planning skills, with the ability to align IT initiatives with business objectives.
  • Stay curious and open to growth — actively building fluency in emerging technologies like AI to unlock creativity, accelerate progress, and amplify impact.

Our Core Behaviors

  • Obsess over customer experience. We deeply understand what we’re building and who we’re building for and serving. We define the leading edge of what’s possible in our industry and deliver the future for our customers
  • Move with heartfelt urgency. We have a healthy relationship with impatience, channeling it thoughtfully to show up better and faster for our customers and for each other. Time is the most limited thing we have, and we make the most of every moment
  • Say the hard thing with care. Our best work often comes from intelligent debate, critique, and even difficult conversations. We speak our minds and don’t sugarcoat things — and we do so with respect, maturity, and care
  • Make your mark. We seek out new and unique ways to create meaningful impact, and we champion the same from our colleagues. We work as a team to get the job done, and we go out of our way to celebrate and reward those going above and beyond for our customers and our teammates

Benefits & Wellness

  • Equity ownership (RSUs) in a growing, privately-owned company
  • 100% employer-paid healthcare, vision, and dental insurance coverage for full-time employees (working 30+ hours per week) and their dependents. Full-time employees may also be eligible for voluntary insurance options where applicable in the respective country of employment
  • 12 weeks of paid parental leave for both birthing and non-birthing caregivers, as well as an additional 6-8 weeks of pregnancy disability leave for birthing parents to be used before child bonding leave (note: where local requirements are more generous, employees receive the greater benefit); full-time employees also have access to family planning care and reimbursement
  • Flexible PTO for all locations and sabbatical program
  • Access to mental wellness and professional coaching, therapy, and Employee Assistance Program
  • Monthly stipends to support work and wellness
  • 401k plan or pension schemes (in countries where statutorily required), and other financial wellness benefits, like CPA and financial advisor coverage

Temporary employees may be eligible for paid holiday and time off, statutory leaves of absence, and company-sponsored medical benefits depending on their Fixed Term Contract and their country/state of employment.

Remote, together
